# fBufferDirection

**Instance Property**

The direction for the buffer to send or receive data.

## Declaration

```swift
uint8_t fBufferDirection;
```

## Discussion

Use the following `DriverKit/IOMemoryDescriptor.h` direction values to populate this field:

- [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/kernel/3852596-anonymous/kiomemorydirectionnone]
- [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/kernel/3852596-anonymous/kiomemorydirectionin]
- [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/kernel/3852596-anonymous/kiomemorydirectionout]
- [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/kernel/3852596-anonymous/kiomemorydirectionoutin]
- [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/kernel/3852596-anonymous/kiomemorydirectioninout]
- [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/kernel/3852596-anonymous/kiomemorydisablecopyonwrite]

## Setting command parameters

- **fLogicalUnitNumber**: The SCSI logical unit number of the device that receives the command.
- **fTimeoutDuration**: A timeout for the command, in milliseconds.
- **fCommandDescriptorBlock**: A 16-byte opcode to fill out the Command Descriptor Block (CDB).
- **fRequestedByteCountOfTransfer**: The size of the data to transfer.
- **fDataTransferDirection**: The direction for the caller to send data to or receive data from the device.
- **fSenseLengthRequested**: The length of sense data to read, in bytes.
- **fDataBufferAddr**: The virtual address of the buffer the dext creates to transfer data.
- **fSenseBufferAddr**: The virtual address of the buffer that the dext creates to transfer sense data.
